channel.title: Laptop Power Adapter
channel.description:
So I was in class and I had my laptop (Gateway M7315U) plugged in like normal. Screen dimmed down and it said it wasn't charging.
Power adapter light was off. Came back on and flickered a few times for the next 30 seconds, and then it completely turned off.
Unplugged it for a few hours. I've tried plugging it into multiple outlets and the light won't turn on anymore and it's not charging my laptop.
So I'm assuming it's dead? I'm looking to buy a new one, but it's SO confusing. Gateway linked me to a retailer of their power adapters.
Picked my model and it gives me two options:
http://www.skyline-eng.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=product.display&Product_ID=5716 http://www.skyline-eng.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=product.display&Product_ID=4823
The 90W one looks exactly like the one I have now, but it says MAKE SURE the Voltage and Amps are the same as your current one. Laptop itself says input: 19V 3.42A. So does the adapter. The 90W one is 19V and 4.74A.
So I goto the 65W one. It has the same 19V 3.42A, but looks different. It only has two prongs.
Both of these I can get for ~$40.
I've found JUST the part that connects to the laptop, but I'm not sure if my power cable or the part that connects is broke. I've found them pretty cheap too, ~$10, but most reviews have said they're all crap.
So, do I get the one that looks like mine but has more Amps, or the one that has the correct Amps but MIGHT be for my model.
Every other site I've been to, when I tell it I have a M7315U it links me to a 19V 4.74A supply. So then why does my laptop say 3.42A on the input?
EDIT:
http://gateway.shopbysystem.com/gateway-90w-replacement-power-adapter-2521997r.html
So that one came up on another search for my model number. It's 90W but says it replaces 65W model.
Also, I can't find my model number under the list of the models for the other two links, but I can on this one. But this one is considerably more.
EDIT2:
http://cgi.ebay.com/AC-Power-Adapter-for-Gateway-M-7309h-M-7315u-M-7305u_W0QQitemZ200434199661QQcmdZViewItemQQimsxZ20100131?IMSfp=TL100131173003r18355
This looks most like mine, and with the same specifications. My only concern is how cheap it is.
Same with this:
http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/B001MQ4JXK/ref=pd_luc_mri?_encoding=UTF8&m=A3NRH9RYFBA5TI&v=glance

item.title: Laptop Power Adapter
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:3, topic:328126”]I went with
http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/B001MQ4JXK/ref=pd_luc_mri?_encoding=UTF8&m=A3NRH9RYFBA5TI&v=glance

My only concern is that it doesn’t show the AC wall adapter in the picture and it doesn’t show what the AC wall adapter plugs into the box with.

All the others ones look like they fit, but plenty of them don’t look the same ie, cord for the wall isn’t grounded with only two prongs.[/quote]
laptops dont need ground

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Power Adapter
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I went with
http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/B001MQ4JXK/ref=pd_luc_mri?_encoding=UTF8&m=A3NRH9RYFBA5TI&v=glance

My only concern is that it doesn’t show the AC wall adapter in the picture and it doesn’t show what the AC wall adapter plugs into the box with.

All the others ones look like they fit, but plenty of them don’t look the same ie, cord for the wall isn’t grounded with only two prongs.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Power Adapter
item.dc:creator: @soul_raever soul raever
item.description:
@soul_raever wrote:

go for one that will deffinatlly fit… so long as its the same voltage and the same or higher amp

Read full topic
